byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and AL BAKER

abstract: Arrest of Akhror Saidakhmetov and Abdurasul Hasanovich Juraboev in Brooklyn on charges of conspiring to commit terrorist acts in league with Islamic State highlights challenges and new intelligence tactics associated with tracking down lone combatants, rather than organized cells; New York City's response has federal agencies and international community examining their own strategies.
lead_paragraph: As officials around the world grapple with the emerging security concerns posed by the Islamic State, the New York case provides one of the first public examples of how officials in the United States are approaching the threat.

headline.main: Brooklyn Arrests Highlight Challenges in Fighting of ISIS and ‘Known Wolves’
headline.print_headline: Arrests of 2 Men in Brooklyn Highlight New Challenges in Fighting ISIS

snippet: As officials around the world grapple with the emerging security concerns posed by the Islamic State, the New York case provides one of the first public examples of how officials in the United States are approaching the threat.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
